Reviews.Title: “Good for one night”
Reviews.Author: NorthVan83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the nigscone fore our flight home. We took transit from the centre of Berlin (TXL bus from the hauptbahnhof to Tegel) and a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel. The hotel is very similar to the Novotel Mitte since it is the same chain. Same, rather small shower/bath combo stall and a room set up for 3 people makes space in the room virtually inexistent. But the rooms were tidy. Very humid inside the building and the room required us to open the window constantly meaning lots of noise from the street and airport where you could see planes moving about out across the fence line. The room was just fine for a one night stay. If you are wanting to explore Berlin's centre which is quite far, I would suggest the shuttle from the airport and then taking the above mentioned TXL bus into town which runs often. 3 English news channels on tv, 2 Internet computers in the lobby. A bar an restaurant downstairs. Guest parking. Overall a nice hotel for the one night.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice near Tegel airport, but still I didnt feel like in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: 99Martina
Reviews.Content: I felt much more like in a students hotel. Rooms small, the interior and lifts looked dirty and very dated (many scratches and stains). Breakfast 19 euro per person, a bit too much for what they offer. However close to the airport, it was quiet, bed and lining good so I had a good sleep. The 2 computers from reception and Internet works so slow, I hated it. If you need to print something you have to send the files on the hotel email address and they print it for you - so zero privacy (not good in a hotel where many guests are business people). If you need the shuttle bus , you have to call to the hotel once you arrived in the airport. I did but the receptionist was not pleased to explain me where do I find the shuttle in the airport. So here the tip- when you arrive, you have to go to the main hall, where you find outside the main bus stations. So follow the sign for BUS in the airport, when you rich the main lobby (at the end of the terminal)go outside, and walk along the bus station where minivans are parked. You will find a Silver minivan with Mercure Airport sticker.

Reviews.Title: “near the airport!”
Reviews.Author: RVD90277
Reviews.Content: ok, you can't get any closer or any more convenient to the airport than this hotel. it's awesome for an early morning flight. i had a 7:20am flight out of tegel so i stayed here and took the free shuttle at 5:45am. it was very convenient and only took about 3 minutes to get to the airport. however, if you're not going to the airport or if you are staying in berlin for more than 1 night, there is absolutely no reason to stay here. there is nothing else to do within walking distance. i don't think there is any public transportation readily available (unless you take the shuttle to the airport and go from there). the hotel and rooms are pretty basic but the place is comfy enough.

Reviews.Title: “Exelent”
Reviews.Author: Georgios G
Reviews.Content: Was staying 8th to 12th of February. Enjoyed once again. Convinient transport to the Airport Tegel. Perfect accomotation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms before early flights”
Reviews.Author: RenataBiancalana
Reviews.Content: It has a perfect location, right next to Tegel Airport, perfect for those that have to get an early flight. The rooms are comfortable and new. The restaurant is above average, with tasty German dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Shirit_11
Reviews.Content: Convenient if you have to catch an early morning flight. Free shuttle to the hotel from the airport and back. We went to the info station at Tegel airport,and ask where is the Shuttle to the Mercure hotel? the clerk called them and told us to wait outside and within 3 minutes the shuttle picked us up. The hotel is about 3 minutes driving from the airport; and it is start from 5am for the first shuttle. Breakfast also start at 5am, not complimentary though.(17euro) The sheets on the bed are low quality compare to other hotels in Germany. Good price and good value especially for advanced purchased.

Reviews.Title: “Flying out of Tegel,Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right at the airport,a five minute shuttle ride.the restaurant is very good,next is a bar enabling guests to sit and relax while enjoying some wine or great german beer.I've stayed there many times and always will when flying out of Tegel.Also the rooms are very clean and comfortable,and the staff always friendly and peofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, efficient”
Reviews.Author: geigerin91
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here just before a morning flight out of Berlin and I would do so again, no doubt. I paid an amazing price in the vicinity of 45 Euros (it's worth hunting around for the best deal) which even included breakfast. It's not really a hotel for the "tourist" due to its location, which is hard to reach with public transport, but for someone who wants to be near the airport it's absolutely perfect. Their free shuttle van took me to the hotel and back to the airport the next morning quickly and on demand. My room was extremely clean and comfortable, with a nice bright bathroom, and I got a great night's sleep - it was very quiet, no noise from planes or anything. In the morning, I enjoyed a tasty and fresh breakfast of good quality, with everything including eggs, cheese, meats, pastries, fruit, juice, etc. All staff I encountered were very friendly. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming staff!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Went out of there way to make our stay pleasant!! we were surprised to see little Christmas gift chocolate bag on our beds! Hardly any wait for airport pickups and drop off!! Virgini and Anton and Sara at the reception and Shuttle driver were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Efficient & Handy.”
Reviews.Author: tara l
Reviews.Content: TRANSFERS Arriving at Berlin airport for the first time and slightly lost and bewildered i approached the information desk to ask about transfers to the hotel. They rang the hotel and directed me in the right direction to get the pickup which was just at the door. The driver did not ask for any ID or anything and there are so many people going to the hotel that it was a comfortable shared experience. Transfers are free. LOCATION Hotel location was very close to airport. Main reason for choosing it is airport handiness. I chose this one because it should have been far away enough to get a good nights sleep away from the noise of flying planes. This info i got from other trip advisor reviews. Thank you trip advisor. =) The hotel is so well insulated you wouldn´t really know you were that close to an airport. So absolutely no worries about noise. There were a few kids playing in hotel at night but that calmed down relatively early. Nothing to do with hotel. CHECK IN Hotel check in staff were extremely efficient and fast. It was a smooth running operation. You just needed to provide credit card as proof of booking. English language of staff was first class. I believe they speak many languages in this hotel. ROOMS: spacious, clean. Sufficient bed linen, lighting, hotel information. TV with free channels and paid. Room service. Mini bar with prices. at mini bar prices to be expected. Hi tech mattress systems and apparently two kids under the age of 16 get to go free. You can even bring pets which is amazing. Wish my wee dog had been there. BATHROOMS: with lots of clean fresh towels. Toilet sealed down with hygiene tapes. Soap, shampoo and body lotion of great quality. Power shower with lots of hot water and bath. Not a giant bath but one if you choose you prefer to relax and unwind from your travels. RESTAURANT: had vegetarian options. plenty of variety. nice wines and of course plenty of german beers to get your travel tastes and experiences going. COMPUTERS: down stairs in lobby with free internet and printing facilities. Wifi in rooms at cost. GYM: apparently they have a gym now. but as a runner they have a wooded park around the hotel which you can walk or run in. They have an out door swimming pool which isn´t heated. My stay was above average for travels and i was pleasantly pleased. For a three star it was superior.

Reviews.Title: “overall egh, average”
Reviews.Author: anchormedia
Reviews.Content: paid for internet, didn't work, or barely did very slowly. shower wasn't clean / scraped up. and tv only has 1 channel non-German (not international friendly), and only for staying at the night before or after a flight - location is good (only for airport), difficult to get to from the city (taking buses from metro then a shuttle from the airport). free shuttle is great. overall it does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight prior to early morning flight from Tegel - Dec 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall atmosphere is upscale, friendly and inviting. More amenities than the typical European hotel - even had bar soap and shampoo/conditioner bottles, similar to typical North American hotels. Note it is not explicitly stated that WiFi access is an additional charge - this should be explicit in the room description, as it is typical to assume if the description says 'WiFi' it is complementary. I did have dinner at the hotel, and aside from the entree being somewhat overcooked (goose leg) and hence a bit chewy, it was a pleasurable experience. The service and presentation were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently close to airport”
Reviews.Author: GerardPost Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very much standard Mercure hotel. Location only convenient for travelers who have an early flight booked and have a rental car at their disposal (or will take a taxi). Difficult to find though. Negative point is the (high) charge for wifi in the room (€3 per hour or €9 per day). These days offering wifi should be like having a TV in the rooms. My recommendation "yes" to friends is only marginal due to the unfavourable location and the extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Airport-Hotel...but nothing more...”
Reviews.Author: 3d-razor
Reviews.Content: Well, time is running out for this hotel, as the new BBI-Airport will be open soon (~7 months from now, if i remember correctly) and the old Berlin Tegel Airport will probably be closed for passenger traffic by the same date. I guess this means that this hotel will loose a big chunk of their customer base and maybe shut down to. So if you need an airport hotel in the near of Tegel Airport in the next half year read on: Location: This seems to be the most centrally located hotel to Tegel airport, which made it my first choice for my overnight stay. The hotel is located about 1 kilometre away from the terminal by foot/car, so if you plan to walk from either the terminal to the hotel or vice versa, or even from the bus stop Luftfracht (like me), keep in mind that it is not a short way, especially not with heavy luggage or before/after dawn in the dark. The hotel is not only a bit out of the way, but also not to easy to find, when you do not know the way and its dark. Luckily the hotel offers a shuttle service from 5 am in the morning, which is operated in a first come, first served way. So come a bit earlier, as you might have to queue for your place in the shuttle bus in the morning. No reservation for a dedicated time is possible, the shuttle just runs between airport and hotel. Hotel: The hotel seems to be build in the 70ties or 80ties and still retained a bit of the "charme" from these years in some parts of the building. My room occured to have been renovated, but this might be some years ago. The hotel was probably a Novotel before, as some items still had the logo of Novotel on it. The hotel has a big lobby, a restaurant (didn't test), two computers in the lobby (handy for online check-in for smartphone ignorants as me) and two elevators. Free parking is also provided, as i have noticed. Rooms: The rooms appeared to be renovated and had typical Mercure look with a large double bed, with a slightly soft mattress, a sofa-chair for relaxing, a desk, a minibar and a really old-school tv. Though it was renovated, you can see that the room isn't the newest one anyone(especially some walls need a face lift). The bath is clean, but doesn't really have the newest deccor anymore. Worse was, that when i entered the room i had fouly smell in my nose, which was easily trackable to come from the bathroom. This smell never stopped in the bathroom. The room was airconditioned and very well noise isolated, which comes in handy, as you might hear the airplanes landing and departing otherwise. Didn't hear any noise from the planes at all. There a few negatives i must point out about the room, apart from the smell in the bathroom: The pillows on the bed were very small, which makes sleep not to comfortable for me. The room didn't have a shower, but a bathtub with a semi-showering place integrated in the bathtube. You may like that or not. The TV is old and small. The remote of my TV was also not working, probably because the batteries were low. Nobody seems to check on this. The hotel was offering a bottle of water for drinking, for the striking price of only 4,10. We are talking about water here, something you get in other hotels for free. The minibar was also locked with a seal, so that you could not look inside without open the seal. There is nothing better than a hotel, that doesn't trust its guest. Last, but not least, the rooms occured clean to me. No complaints. Breakfast: Costs extra, so i didn't try. Staff: The staff made a mixed impression on me. Though being overall nice, they are a bit to lax, not to professional. First they didn't find my reservation, because their own booking systems mixed something up and then they failed to inform me about the possibility of the airport transfer and also about a wake up call. I had to ask for this myself. When asking about the airporttransfer, the receptionist also made a bit of an annoyed look, as if he is tired of telling everybody to come 15 minutes early, before they want to go. Well, as i said, there were overall nice, but not as professional as in other hotels. Overall a very solid hotel, nothing fancy, everything a bit older, but reliable. I wouldn't want to stay here for longer, but for one night it is really okay, especially if you really need a hotel near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel - free shuttle to the airport”
Reviews.Author: alespesl
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend have stayed in this hotel 1 night. Next morning we had a flight to Krakow, Poland. We have arrived around midnight. Check in was very easy, we got a standard twin room. In the morning, nice buffet breakfast was served. Many choices provided, no complaints here. The rate we paid was around 70 eur/night for both of us, very acceptable for the proximity to the airport. Big plus was the free shuttle to the airport. Once can even walk to the airport in about 15 mins. If I had an early flight from Berlin Tegel, than I would stay here again. For city hopping, it would be better to stay more close to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Typical Mercure Hotel at an airport, no problem with cleanliness, quality, friendliness of staff etc etc. More exp[ensive than I would have liked, but that's Mercure and the location is great along with a free shuttle bus to teh airport, made the transfer much more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay right by airport”
Reviews.Author: RoosterTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure hotel as we had to overnight with our flights and found it was very clean, comfortable, nicely decorated and efficient. There is a free shuttle to the airport. We called the hotel when we arrived and it took about 5 minutes to be picked up. Staff were friendly and the meal we had in the restaurant was good as well. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Berlin Airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Practical hotel that is convenient to Airport. Rooms are clean. Food is reasonable and service very good. Check in is fast except when they have a fire alarm test. Checkout was efficient and transport to and from airport an excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not special”
Reviews.Author: Rodomontade
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in order to catch an early flight back to the US. The room was minimally furnished. I had a meal at the restaurant, which was reasonably priced and reasonably good. The personnel (wait staff and front desk) were very pleasant. The shuttle took me the short ride to the airport early in the morning as soon as I checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Usefully nice”
Reviews.Author: MartiniWarsaw
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there twice. Always on the way when we go on our holidays (or when we come back home). We like Berlin as a starting point. The hotel is well-run. Clean, well-equipped (as for 3-star hotel) rooms. Good food. A spacious, safe car park (free of charge for the hotel guests; depends on a room rate). The hotel shuttle bus - working perfectly. We are going to stay there again, that` for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Georgios G
Reviews.Content: Stayed February 2011 perfect location value for money

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed Convinient budget hotel for airport stay”
Reviews.Author: nkg1949
Reviews.Content: we liked this hotel very much for ; 1) very convinient to go to Tegel airport for early morning flight 2) very freindly airport free drop service 3) multi-cuisine restaurant with good selection 4) very soft on pocket, low costs recommended for family travellers

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable...but be careful to extra services!”
Reviews.Author: Tonionss
Reviews.Content: Well...only 85 euros for a confortable and silent room next to Tegel Airport would be worth more than three stars...But the extra services are hyperbolic! 17 euros for breakfast, 6 euros for two hour internet connection, 10 euros for hotel car park. (and we don't mention minibar and other confort). I will return to it...if I haven't got a car...and I won't have breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Solution - Late Arrival and Early Flight”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Best solution there except for the lack of signage or instruction on how to catch the shuttle from Tegel Airport to the hotel Fitness, sauna and steam facility is a good relief for business traveler Restaurant simple, economical but good enviroment

Reviews.Title: “Sleep and again to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Wind41
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and stylish, and the park-like location is ideal for air travelers -- only a few minutes from Tegel Airport (with a free shuttle bus running most of the day). Multi-lingual staff was extraordinarily helpful, and all pre-arrival e-mail/phone communication was prompt and customer-focused. Incredibly accommodating -- from storing some luggage to serving a very good and fresh dinner after midnight to front desk service to shuttle driver courtesy. We felt pampered -- at a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “ok only”
Reviews.Author: John_Evans1951
Reviews.Content: - not very clean (hair from previous guest on shower) - service average (they forgot my hot chocolate until I had to go) - issues with shuttle bus which they say is there every 5 minutes, but sometimes it is just not there. I had to run to the airport to catch my flight - nice sizable room but a bit aged - quiet - when the shuttle bus is running it is quite handy - nice forest for jogging nearby

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel, very close and quiet”
Reviews.Author: travelabit
Reviews.Content: Good location, and one of the few that has an airport shuttle to Tegal airport. Slept well here. Be careful when showering as the tub floor is very slippery, and the elevated tub makes it a big step in and out. TVs are older style, but OK if your just using this location to be close to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, friendly and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: KateMurrayMum
Reviews.Content: Room clean and perfect size for our family. Plain, tasteful decor. Staff very efficient but in a relaxed, friendly way. Nice outdoor area too. Breakfast a bit expensive but more than you can eat and didn't mind paying as everything else was so good. Shuttle bus to/from airport very handy - need to get aiport information to ring them when you arrive and bus picks you up in a few mins.

Reviews.Title: “It was Gross”
Reviews.Author: acdc3301
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the proximity to the airport and we had an early flight. I would have rather had a commute. The bathroom, specifically the bathtub had obviously not been cleaned in a long time. The grime was disgusting. There was a strange smell in the bathroom. The carpet in the hallways nasty and in the room too. The pillow cases seem to have been in a mixed wash, dryer because there was lint on them. The reception upon check in was very nice - her name was Rebeca. The following morning, not so much. In any other hotel our bill would have been discounted or at least breakfast would have been complimentary but not here. They offered nothing of any value to us - a drink from the mini bar..ridiculous

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is my pleasure to write few words concerning my stay in your hotel , first of all I would like to congratulate you for choosing this site just close to the airport It was of great help . The least thing I suppose is that why the free Internet service not included in , although you offer this service with charge Apart from this, the services and cooperation of the staff was really good . Thank you for your hospitality .

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fairplayfella Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location for airport with free shuttle bus. Bar food was good. At this price I would expect tea & coffee making facilities in the room, which were lacking. Staff were all helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was good. No hotels nearer to the airport were seen.

Reviews.Title: “Veryy poor quality in service”
Reviews.Author: ogtl1980
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel the reservation we had made (paid in advanced through Expedia) could not be found in the sytem (even though I had the confirmation in my laptop to prove it). While I was at the front desk, I did not get help from the staff it looks like the 2 staff members (Bruno Costa & Ricarda Gunther) in front desk just don´t care about me, no options were given and the lady (Ricarda Gunther) went to grab a bite while I was standing waiting for a solution from them. I end up finding the name of Nicole Kluck in tripadvisor who seems to be a team member of the management staff of the hotel and told the receptionist that I wanted to talk to her, when the receptionist heard that she´s suddenly started to pay more attention to me and told me after 20 minutes of being waiting that she will call his reservations manager to see what happened with my booking. I realized that this hotel just doesn´t care about their customers. I was coming from a long flight really tired and I had to take another flight very early the next morning that´s why I end up choosing that hotel to stay in the beginning. But anyway now I´m 100% sure I have learned the lesson and next time I will stay anywhere else in Berlin just avoid the lack of service that this hotel has. Before loading this review to the tripadvisor website I realized that this has happened before to some other guests and seems that the reservation process of the hotel is not accurate. The hotel is in good shape it is a shame that the front desk has a very poor sense of what hotel service means.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: themotorcycleman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1 night while attending a conference. I chose the hotel for its proximity to the airport as I was simply flying in and then back out again. Very pleasantly surprised. Friendly airport shuttle, wooded surroundings, friendly staff, reasonably priced dinner (breakfast less so at €17), spacious comfortable and clean room, ditto bathroom. prices seem to vary between €50 and €75/nt at this time of year. It has an outdoor pool, play area, spacious wooded grounds and sheltered from the ring road by trees and fences so good for kids too.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location at the airport-near busstop luftfracht or walk-20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book the rate incl. Wifi - you'll pay, but won't get free wifi. Good airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: pentigara
Reviews.Content: On the accor website, I booked a "privilege room" at this hotel. The rate was 25 Euro higher than the hotel's "standard room" rate. They still offer this rate. For this I was supposed to get more comfort. Quote from the webpage "Privilege rooms for more comfort: VIP bathroom incl. bathrobes, mineral water, coffee/tea and newspaper free of charge in the room. Also including: Wi-Fi, late checkout and double A|Club points." When I arrived at the hotel, I expected to get a WiFi voucher at no extra cost, but they said I have to pay for it. I told them, I booked including wifi , cited the booking and they still said no. I would only get a 5 Euro rebate with this rate and only if I purchased the full day pass, no rebate on the smaller vouchers. "Including WiFi" here supposedly only means, that the room has Wifi. For me, that's a very debateable interpretation of what they wrote. I really hate it, when the deliberately try to rip you off and that's how I interpret it. What I did get, was the bathrobe and the water. The coffee/tea maker in the room, I also paid extra for, was broke. It countinuously tried to heat up and then stopped after a few seconds. Since my flight was in the early morning, I don't know about the newspaper and I don't use AClub. What was great though, was the excellent airport shuttle service and the room was ok, too. Pro: - Close to the airport (four minute shuttle ride), ideal for early flights - very good and free on demand shuttle. Note down the hotel phone number and call the hotel, when you're at the public bus terminal at the airport (close to gate A0). The shuttle will arrive about four minutes after the call. - free internet terminals incl. printer in the lobby negative: - no free wifi, even though the rate I paid said "including wifi" - coffee/tea maker broke Conclusion: Good airport hotel, but don't bother with the "Privilege room". You most likely won't get what you pay extra for.

Reviews.Title: “Typical airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: WEISSBIER
Reviews.Content: With the lack of airport shuttles by German hotels we chose this property as other travelers mentioned that it's accessible by foot from the airport. We arrived on a cold night and it was a long walk. The front desk was not friendly at all, that did not change at check out either. The room was small and barely acceptable for a one night stay. There was no coffee machine in room, no free internet, no free parking. The hotel is out in the woods and there is nothing around it except old abandoned garden sheds and a dog training facility. We were happy to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Airport Hotel At A Good Price”
Reviews.Author: PHX_Travel_Guys
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Sunday evening as I had an early flight out of Berlin Tegel on Monday morning. Staff was very pleasant. My German is terrible, and I tried a bit, but they spoke English very well. They have a very convenient shuttle to the airport, but it fills up fast, so get out to the curb quickly when it comes by (every 10-20 minutes, starting at 5:00 AM). For only 59 Euro, it was a bargain. The room was clean and comfortable. The WiFi was not included, but was only 4 Euro for 5 hours. Had a pleasant meal in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Mafioso
Reviews.Content: Ideally located for travelers leaving from Tegel airport, especially for early morning flights with free shuttle service. Pleasant restaurant moderately priced. Room and bathroom fully equipped but double bed only had a blanket for a single person. We later found a second blanket in one of the drawers. Next time would rather use twin beds. Staff very friendly and helpful. Altogether a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: shinyredvespa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Tegel for one night before an early-morning flight out of Berlin, and it is much as advertised. The front desk staff was excellent: extremely helpful and efficient. The hotel is set up mostly for business travelers, so it's comfortable but fairly utilitarian. There isn't much except the airport in the immediate vicinity, but there is a restaurant and bar on site (prices are a bit on the high side, but we had a satisfying dinner for two for about 25 euros). The room itself was comfortable, with no frills. There are two free computer terminals in the lobby, as well as a free shuttle to and from the airport -- it comes every 10 minutes or so during the day, and is also available by request late at night. The convenience of being close to the airport for an early flight was priceless! Note: if taking public transport to the Mercure from the city center, it's easiest to go to the airport then call the front desk to request the shuttle. We took the U-Bahn then TXL bus, and called when we arrived at Tegel. The shuttle picked us up within five minutes, and it was super easy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides an excellent service. Personnel is friendly, rooms are cosy and clean. An advice - the rooms on each floor ...20-30 are rather close to the highway and may be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Got zapped”
Reviews.Author: Eggs_Benedict
Reviews.Content: If you intend to stay at this very convenient hotel to Tegel airport be sure to reserve well in advance and you will get a decent rate. I did so and got a 59 Euro rate a night for two nights (no breakfast) and two weeks later reserved 69 Euros with breakfast. However, I arrived there a day earlier............zappo, for the same room I had to pay 199 Euros for that one early night. Front desk answer - "We use dynamic pricing". I call that zapping the customers. Otherwise the restaurant is very good, service decent and place is clean and quiet. Shuttle to airport is handy.

Reviews.Title: “super value!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaAnton
Reviews.Content: For the paid 69 Euro per night we've got typical accor hotel. But that does not mean negative if you are for a transit there. The room was large enough, very clean, room sevice was fast and the food tasty, breakfast had a good variety and they even has an outdoor pool (not suitable for september but in general). If you are on a transit in Berlin - take it!

Reviews.Title: “Good for stranded passengers”
Reviews.Author: RosannaT
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to live Berlin yesterday but we had problem with our Lufthansa flight so they booked us at the hotel - very close to Berlin Tegel airport. The hotel is very clean, the staff is very friendly and the restaurant has great food. Unfortunately the wireless connection is for pay and is EXTREMELY sluggish. The only free connection they have you have to log in through two desktop computers which are extremely sluggish as well. Despite being close the airport all computers are set up in German :( The hotel provides a shutlle that picks you up from the airport and takes you back there. If you want to go to Berlin from here the tax ride costs about 15 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Not anything exceptional at all !”
Reviews.Author: Burgsinn
Reviews.Content: As the name shows, this hotel was easily OK. Located near the airport befitting for an flights. The room was usually clean and comfortable. Internet cost 8.00 Euro-24hrs. Restaurant restricted list items-but good. buffet breakfast was OK, including your room rate. Telephone allegations - outrageous. Gym/exercise locality is minute, as well as the sauna /relaxation Area's. Just OK - not anything exceptional at all !

Reviews.Title: “All you expect from a nearby airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: picknicker1971
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located 3min grom Tegel (TXL) airport. It is a very pleasant hotel with all amenities which expect from hotel of this category. The rooms are tidy and furnished “up-to date”. There is WiFi access for free. The breakfat offers a varity of warm and cold dishes. The hotel provides you a free shuttle service to the airport, which brings in 3min to the terminal. When coming from the airport to the hotel you better use the shuttle as well. Taxi drivers will be more than upset (if they take you !) for this short ride, considering that they line up for a couple of hours.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed with the miscommunication”
Reviews.Author: Semgem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our last night in Europe, and actually the only major hiccup with our whole trip. When we got to the hotel the reservation (paid up-front) we had made could not be found in the system (even though we brought the paperwork to prove it). This could easily have been an honest mistake, but since our name was not in the system we had to book the room again and pay again. (The staff was very courtious and offered us complementary drinks at the bar). The second miscommunication happened the following morning with our shuttle to the airport. We had received a shuttle pass card from the evening staff for the following morning. However when checking out, the morning staff insisted that we pay for the shuttle, even when we had the card given to us by the evening staff for the shuttle the next morning. The miscommunications that were at this hotel were not the end of the world, but it was not the way that I wanted to end a vacation. It seemed that some of the staff are courteous and willing to help, while others could seem to care less about the hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “A positive experience in a standard mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: lv6ph
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nothing special, but it never claimed it was - it is exactly what you bargained for. It offers a standard room and standard service at a good price. The location is very convenient, 5 minutes from the airport, and there is a shuttle service that costs 1 euro. It takes about 15 minutes to get from the airport to downtown, so I don't see a reason to pay twice as much for a similar hotel downtown. I arrived around 10 am, way before the check-in time, but staff were very polite and agreed to check me in since my rooms was ready. The room was clean and spacious, and much to my delight, I did not hear the noise from the airport. The bathroom was spotless, too, and I liked that the hotel participates in a green initiative with the UN, where for every 10 towels that are used two days in a row (guests can opt-out of the scheduled daily change), a tree is planted. The night was peaceful and quiet, with no rowdy guests disturbing everyone else. Breakfast was excellent, with a large variety of choices. One thing that can be improved is that the website says there is a shuttle, but it doesn't say you can call it from one of the free phones at Tegel airport. You can also have the airport information desk call it, but you have to figure that out yourself. If you have a cell phone that works in Europe, it's not a big deal, but if you don't, calling the shuttle can be a hassle if you have to do it yourself from a regular phone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Clean room”
Reviews.Author: made_in_ukraine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located for those who need to make an overnight stop in Berlin Tegel Airport. Located within a 2-minute ride on a complimentary shuttle from the main terminal, the location could not be better. To call the shuttle, one should ask at the airport's Info Desk. Check-in/out was smooth. The rooms are large, with all necessary amenities. While being close to the airport, the noise was not a problem. The breakfast was ample and would cater to both a variety of tastes. Overall, a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Hop to Tegel Airport”
Reviews.Author: sagecrest
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel if you need one near Tegel Airport. Quality staff and efficient shuttle service with almost no wait. Two computers with Internet access and printers are free in the lobby. Rooms are comfortable although the carpets need attention. Twin sets of windows eliminate aircraft noise. Tasty breakfast in a nice setting. Good value. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: tygrlive
Reviews.Content: if you need good room close to Tegel Airport, go for it. Excellent service (I made booking same day of arrival, via email, no credit card confirmation), clean calm rooms and good beer at cocpit bar :) First time there, but not last!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise at a major airport location”
Reviews.Author: 1oldtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Berlin Airport one day and night in November 2009. We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel and the service. I am not a fan of "near airport" hotels. They are usually very impersonal and cold. They are guaranteed a steady flow of customers because of their location. The average expense account flier will assure profitability; why bother to be nice? We arrived early from the city and our room was available.The room amenities were what one would expect from a business class hotel. There was no noticeable airplane noise and no noise from the roadway nearby. We made good use of the free airport shuttle. The drivers were efficient and always there to pick us up or drop off. We ere able to get into Berlin easily from the airport and it was easy to make the early flight out in the morning. The restaurant was a real find. The food was well prepared and well presented. We have had mixed success with chain hotel food service. The restaurant in the Mercure airport Berlin could stand on its' own as a destination. Service in the restaurant and the attached bar was very friendly and personable. We felt the staff actually LIKED having us there. This stay was not at all what I expected from an airport attached hotel. We enjoyed this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Average, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: mrsgilly8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before flying out of Berlin. The Hotel was very average and nothing to rave about. They did have pickup service to and from the airport which was very convenient. The room was small and the beds were okay. In the bathroom there was a terrible smell. We couldn't figure out where it was coming from as it was only in the bathroom. The bathroom was clean so we thought maybe it was coming from the septic tank or plumbing system. We arrived after eleven o'clock, just went straight to bed and we were too tired to call the front desk about the smell. It wasn't in the bedroom part of the room. The next morning it was still there. Just a quick shower and out of the room. The breakfast was adequate but nothing to rave about. This was an okay place to stay if you need to get to the airport in the morning. The halls were rather shabby and it looked like an older hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Far from tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: Panndell
Reviews.Content: Five minutes from the airport and 40 minutes from Brandenburg Gate. Good for business travelers who can claim reimbursement for taxi and/or car rentals or those who have an early flight out of Berlin. Need to rely on the one hotel shuttle to get to the airport to take public transport to main attractions. Hotel is nice size and offers two computers with free internet in the lobby. Hotel staff do not appear to be knowledgeable with the city or public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a very good price”
Reviews.Author: spygr
Reviews.Content: It was next to the airport.The rooms and the hotel in general they were very good for the price we paid.They had a free shuttle from and to the airport the room service was very good and it had free internet.i must not forget the bar in which we had a drink for a very reasonable price and very friendly personel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: eves21
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel if you need to stay close to the airport, we got a good earlybird rate through the internet. The room was modern and spacious and the service staff were all really efficient and friendly. There is a restaurant attached with a varied menu and some good wines, for a restaurant with a captive audience it does very well in price, service and quality. There is a convenient shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good for tourists with car”
Reviews.Author: David92263
Reviews.Content: No forward planning means using ingenuity. I figured there would be a plethora of hotels adjacent to the airport. Wrong. There's a very pricey Holiday Inn and the Mercure. Well I arrived by car and would be touring round with the aid of GPS in the car so location adjacent to the airport was just a matter of convenience. The hotel was OK. Easy to find and the Navi GPS was a godsend. I wouldn't recommend this for folks without a car. There's a restaurant but I only used it once for dinner and once for breakfast. Both were good quality. The bar was small, friendly and like airport hotel bars everywhere not cheap. Room servicing was good and efficient. I would use it again - car parking at €5 per night could have been included in the room tariff but I guess that would lead to long term parkers for Tegel Airport. There was no noticeable aircraft noise.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport, Very nice and clean, free airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: TiestoFan242
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, short 5 min ride to Airport if that. Pool Outside. Nice bar/ lobby area. Rooms nice size, and bed comfortable. Can pick up bus from airport into city if you would like. Great stay for being close to airport, if have to catch an early flight, but is a bit out of city center

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: chizabela
Reviews.Content: close to the airport, shuttle available even if you arrive very late, just call them and they will pick you up. Very clean, really nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location for travelling”
Reviews.Author: ochlophobic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Airport Tegel for two nights in order to have a quick return visit to Berlin before flying out relatively early on the third day. The hotel was clean, comfortable and friendly with the free shuttle a great help as we had suitcases. From the hotel it was only a 5 minute walk to catch the 109 bus towards the city, which runs frequently. The breakfast was ample with a wide selection of good quality food - a great start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Straight from the plane”
Reviews.Author: rustybodog
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I would be arriving in Berlin late in the evening, and did not want the hassle of getting to downtown. The shuttle arrived shortly after calling them, and I was in my room within 30 minutes of getting my luggage from the flight. I stayed 2 nights and felt safe and secure while there. I ordered room service for dinner and received an excellent chicken salad.

Reviews.Title: “Stay the night before you leave.”
Reviews.Author: Basiluzzo
Reviews.Content: This is a bare-bones but perfectly adequate business hotel just a 5-minute shuttle ride from the Tegel airport terminal. We have stayed in Berlin twice, and both times stayed here the night before our early morning departure. It is nothing special but clean and comfortable with free computer terminals in the lobby and a small restaurant and bar. The day of our departure we checked out of our hotel in central Berlin, did a day of visiting museums, ate a late lunch, and then took a cab out to the Mercure (about 20 euros). This made for a no-stress departure the next morning, and saved money besides. It has a tiny pool and workout room, and only one English tv station, but that wasn't the point ... We slept well and were able to wake up and be at the airport gate 45 minutes later! By the way the hotel restaurant is expensive (of course) but there are plenty of breakfast options at the airport - Tegel is a snap to negotiate.

Reviews.Title: “Serves Its Purpose As Airport Hotel-Not Much More”
Reviews.Author: PlateMan
Reviews.Content: Pretty average airport hotel. Check-in took a long time as a group was checking in before. Room was nicely appointed but the bed was pretty uncomfortable, also the hotel pushes its for-sale breakfast heavily. Hotel is also very isolated, there is literally nothing around it and they knew this. Thus, a bottle of water was extremely expensive and food options are limited. Front desk is unaccommodating. I asked for a runway view room and was told no. The tv in the room is also very old and internet expensive. However, it served its purpose as an airport hotel. It was a safe place to stay and had an on-time free shuttle ride in the morning to Tegel.

Reviews.Title: “only for a transit stop”
Reviews.Author: rojersey
Reviews.Content: We needed an overnight in Berlin with a 6 am flight the following morning. The Mercure was clearly our only choice. They never told us how to avail ourselves of their free shuttle from Tegel but serendipitously we figured it out. For those who would be better prepared in knowing: go to the Information Desk and they will phone the shuttle. With that it took about 15 minutes for the shuttle to arrive, by which time we were solidly frozen. Our arrival at the hotel was a bit confused.....them, not us. We got a key to room 214 and it didn't work. Both of us, exhausted air warriors, struggled with the key and just as we were about to return to reception, the door did open, albeit from the INSIDE. The woman sleeping there obviously wasn't very safety conscious but that's another story. Eventually we did get a room of our own. It was compact and clean with a shower that required a phone call to learn how to operate and was located in a bathtub that a gymnast might find easy to enter but we did not! We had ordered a wakeup call both from the reception and from the easily operated alarm on the inroom phone. One of them did work.....and that was the one we set in the room. We still await the reception's wakeup call. Similarly with a cab (the shuttle doesn't start until 5 a.m. which was too late for us). The promised cab was never ordered. When we got downstairs they were completely clueless to our cab reservation of the night before. They hastened to call a cab with no apology in sight and we did get to our flight on time. What is striking about all of this is that this is a hotel that one would only stay in for transit so it should be a finely honed operation when it comes to wakeup calls and taxis. We were quite surprised at their inefficiency. So, if you need to stay here, be forewarned that you will find some incompetence for which you will have to compensate.

Reviews.Title: “If you like planes...”
Reviews.Author: sask1234
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Germany with my Grade 11 Class last year, and I loved the whole experience! This hotel was one of the nicer ones we stayed in, but the Tegel airport is literally right next door.. The planes didnt bother us too much as we were so tired we went right to sleep, but you can definitely hear them! The lobby is very spacious and modern with Wi-Fi to use, as well as computers. They were VERY patient with our group. The staff seemed very pleasant and helpful. A bit of a jaunt to the sights of Berlin, but a very nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: amandeep
Reviews.Content: I had a chance to stay at the Mercure Airport Hotel Berlin Tegel in March 2008. I was there in Berlin to attend ITB Fair. This hotel is far from the main city but it had big clean rooms with all the modern facilities and is very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: tmccaleb
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night prior to flying back to the States. Location is excellent for access to the airport--walking distance if you wish. Rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. We had two adult parents and one adult child. Restaurant was satisfactory. And the hotel price was an excellent value, better than we are accustomed to in the U.S. Not luxury, but a cut above a basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A COMFORTABLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Balustroid
Reviews.Content: First time in Germany, I booked a hotel nearby the Tegel Airport. Stayed for a few nights (3 I think). As soon as I arrived at Tegel from Zurich on Air Berlin, I went to the Information desk to ask how to get to the hotel. Apparently, I had to go to the next building (terminal) for the pick-up bus to Mercure. After 4 minutes walk, I got to the other terminal, and went to the information desk and the lady said she would call the hotel for pick-up and I was asked to wait outside the terminal (10 seconds walk). The mini van arrived and the journey to the hotel took about 6 minutes. The hotel is quite nice, you will see a lot of big trees outside and you can go for a walk. The lobby is fairly big and there are two computers offering free internet. The check-in was quick. There's a restaurant and a sitting area (lounge) and there's a swimming pool outside where you can also sit/have a drink. My room was clean with a small bathroom. It's a copy of Novotel Zurich (if you have stayed at Novotel Zurich then, you can imagine this Mercure room that I got). Nice comfortable bed, clean linen etc. with shower gel/shampoo/soap in the bathroom. I don't remember making my own coffee there so I don't think there was tea/coffee making facilities in the room. TV channels were OK, mostly in German language. I went for a walk during my stay to the airport (20 minutes walk) since that is the only place of civilisation whereby you can get newspapers and food if you don't want to eat in the hotel. There is a petrol station on the way to the airport with a shop called Bistro. I was delighted thinking of the hot foods/pastries that I was going to buy at Bistro, but when I went inside the only hot thing they sell is coffee! You can buy chocolate and junk food here though. On my first day out in Berlin, I took the free mini van service from the hotel (you have to request for this, say 10 mins before you need it) to Tegel and caught a bus into Berlin. I took X9 bus and paid 2.10 Euro for a single journey, per person. The journey by bus to Berlin (Zoo Garden) took about 25 minutes. On my return journey, I asked the info centre at Tegel airport to call Mercure for the pick-up for me.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: surlaw888
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night prior to flying out of Berlin. For the rock-bottom price we paid for the room via the hotel's website, we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are spacious, clean and modern. The hotel is almost IN the airport (you can see the runway out of the window) but there is almost no airport noise. There's an excellent shuttle service that takes you to the airport within minutes. You can get into the city by public transport, but it is a bit of a trek (shuttle then bus then U-bahn) so I wouldn't recommend it for exploring the city. The breakfast buffet is good, but not included in all room prices. Staff are friendly and helpful. We'd be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for early flight or late arrival”
Reviews.Author: bubbagumpshrimp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night since we had an early flight and it was a very nice hotel, especially for the price. Our room was big, very clean, and aesthetically pleasing. You are right in the airport though so this is not a great place to stay while you are trying to explore Berlin. Also, the restaurant was a little pricey and fancy for our taste so we had a hard time finding dinner. They will order pizza delivery for you but it is not good at all! The shuttle service was fantastic; the first shuttle leaves at 5am and when you need a ride to or from the airport they are there in just a few minutes. Overall, we were very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location right at airport”
Reviews.Author: AKaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and the location was excellent! The price was reasonable per room. Breakfast was provided but not included in the price and we did not take advantage of it. We did eat dinner in their very nice restaurant and found it delicious, although the service was slow and poor. The rooms are very basic, but clean and comfortable and quiet. There was a pool but we did not use utilize this either because it was outdoors and quite cool. The front desk staff were super! We were able to check in and out quite easily, and there was an added bonus - there is a large electronic screen display in the lobby which shows the current flights and gates for departure at the airport. This was an incredibly useful feature. This hotel also offers free shuttle service to the airline gates.

Reviews.Title: “Only on night spent”
Reviews.Author: sppetrovic
Reviews.Content: We had just spent the last two weeks in Czech Republic and were flying out of Berlin back to the USA. We booked the hotel because it would have been a 5 hour drive & we were leaving early in the morning. The price was just right. This was one of the better hotels we were in. The beds were very comfortable. the staff was so friendly and even ordered a pizza for us as the pizza place did not speak english. It is just a short walk or drive from the airport. So if you miss the shuttle bus and don't have much luggage you can walk to the hotel. We had walked back after dropping the rental car off at the airport. This was a great airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our stay”
Reviews.Author: floridagalNaples
Reviews.Content: This property was beautifully and efficiently decorated. The staff were very helpful, efficient, welcoming and professional. My husband and sixteen year old son and I shared a room with double bed and fold out couch. It was spacious enough to meet our needs, and beds were comfortable. It is perfectly located for quick access to Tegel airport and the free shuttle is a bonus. The property is close to quick bus access and the staff was very helpful in helping us to use both bus as well as hotel shuttle to meet our sightseeing needs. The breakfast was not included in our rate, which is not too surprising given the excellent rate for such a nice hotel. We did enjoy the lavish breakfast buffet once, but it's a bit much in price and quantity unless you are counting on sustenance to last the day. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: udalvr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night - 30 July 2007. I was given a twin room. Breakfast included. The room was very comfortable and clean. Nice bathroom. Only compliants - Broadband access was too costly and you are expected to carry your luggage on your own to your room......this is an airport hote...people arrive with bags and bags. They could do with a porter service.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: FlashSydney
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night because we were arriving late from London - about 11pm. The price was right - 47 euros for a room. We ran into a little trouble when we arrived. The free shuttle bus ends at 11pm and we just missed the last one. We could not get any of the taxi drivers to take us because it was such a small fare. However, I called the hotel using the free dedicated phone in the airport terminal and the man on reception sent one within five minutes. Great service. The hotel room was much better than I expected for the money - a decent size, beautiful clean sheets, two twin beds and spotless throughout. All the staff were very helpful and polite. I speak German but they all spoke great English for anyone who doesn't. We didn't stay for breakfast as we were leaving for central Berlin first thing in the morning - only a 15 to 20 minute cab ride away. The checkout was quick, friendly and the receptionist called us a cab at once. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who needs an overnight stay at Tegel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, very quiet, very nice”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissK
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant stay. I was a bit apprehensive about staying so far from Berlin's centre initially. I had booked last minute and my travel agent hadn't been able to find anything else. So I took this booking and gave it a chance. To get into Berlin, you hop on the free shuttle to Tegel airport. Then you grab an X97 (Can't remember the exact number, be sure to check before you go) bus and it can drop you at a number of main stops including the Hauptbahnhof and Unter Den Linden. The room was aesthetically pleasing and very very quiet. Room service was yum, the TV was a bit tricky to work, too many steps to get to free-to-air tv I thought. Bathroom was gorgeous, lots of room and the shower worked, though it was slow to drain sometimes. The breakfast served in the restaurant was amazing. 2 types of scrambled eggs and anything your heart desired. I was a bit disappointed at how crowded it was on New Years Eve morning, there was barely any food, drinks and plates around and the kitchen seemed a little slow to replenish supplies. Surely knowing how many guests they were going to have they could've staffed the restaurant a little better? The 24-hr reception staff were very helpful, friendly and spoke good english. Near the toilets in the lobby there is a rack containing touristy cards for all the major Barlin attractions, I found these helpful. Internet access was my only problem. The hotel offers access via a third party terminal but this was extremely expensive. The airport has little stands but I couldn't access my webmail via these. I think if I had've had a laptop with me I might've been able to connect from my room free but I didn't so I'll never know! If you need postal services, front desk can offer limited service. Your next best bet is to take the shuttle bus to the airport, there is a post office there where you can send parcels, anything other than plain letters and postcards. The lady that helped me didn't speak english so knowing a bit of german might help you there. There is also a small supermarket type store that sells foody bits at the airport. This is handy if you don't want to pay out for room service, but just want some fruit and drinks etc. One big warning though - there are 2 Mercure hotels at Tegel airport, make sure you arrive at the right one. It is a 10 minute cab ride if you go to the wrong one. Overall, a great stay and if I knew someone who had to hang out near the airport for a night or 2, i'd recommend it to them. If you want easy access to the city of Berlin, you might want to look at a hotel closer in and save yourself the commute.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: SenseIntoDollars
Reviews.Content: Functional but nothing special. Won't stay open once the airport is closed in a year or so.

Reviews.Title: “just fine for what it is”
Reviews.Author: njtraveler15
Reviews.Content: this hotel was just fine - tastefully decorated rooms, quiet, comfortable, convenient airport shuttle. got a 49 euro rate on the internet and thought that was worth it for what we needed, which was transportation from the airport the first day and to the airport the next. however, beware of other fees- breakfast is 14 euros a person, they charge for internet access, etc etc...you could easily spend more on extras than you paid for the room! also bathrooms don't appear to have been updated in awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: AK-in-NC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night after getting into Tegel at night and leaving that next morning. Upon arriving at the hotel, I was checked in and given a key card. Mind you, it was about 11 PM and I was pretty tired. So, I went up to my room, inserted the key card and opened the door. I was greeted by a shocked "Hallo" from some poor German woman who was already in that room. They gave me a room with someone else already in it. I must have scared the daylights out of that poor woman. So I walked back down to the check in desk and told them what had happened. The clerk then gave me another key card to another room. While I was there, one of the guests called to report an intruder (me, I'm guessing). From overhearing some of that conversation in my very broken German, I think a weak apology was given, and that was it. After I got to my new room (very carefully opening the door this time), I finally got some peace and quiet. The bathroom was fine and functioned well, but the bed was not very comfortable and I did not get much sleep. My biggest complaint is that I don't think the woman I walked in on due to the incompetence of the hotel staff was compensated in any way. Upon coming back to Berlin I stayed at the Hilton instead. Was it more expensive? You betcha. Was the room more comfortable? By leaps and bounds. Was the stay more restful? Absolutely. Even the more complicated transit to and from the hotel was nothing compared to the overall better facalities at the Hilton.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Airport Hotel Berlin Tegel
HotelInfo.Address: Kurt Schumacher Damm 202, 13405 Berlin, Germany (Formerly Novotel)
